title: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time
creator_credit: Happinet Pictures, Kadokawa Pictures, Memory Tech, Q-Tec, Toki wo Kakeru Shôjo Seisaku Iinkai 2006, Madhouse, Sound Box, Kadokawa Shoten Publishing, Takafumi Watanabe, Jungo Maruta, Mamoru Hosoda, Yuichiro Saito and Satoko Okudera
brief_description: When 17-year-old Makoto Konno gains the ability to, quite literally, “leap” backwards through time, she immediately sets about improving her grades and preventing personal mishaps. However, she soon realises that changing the past isn’t as simple as it seems, and eventually, will have to rely on her new powers to shape the future of herself and her friends.

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.
